document_data.caption: Sebek on the far right.
document_data.name: Sebek
document_data.title:
Lord of Crocodiles
The Smiling Death
document_data.symbol5e: Crocodile head with horns and plumes
document_data.symbol4e: Crocodile head surmounted by a horned, plumed headdress.
document_data.symbol3e: Crocodile head surmounted by a horned, plumed headdress.
document_data.symbol2e: Crocodile head surmounted by a horned, plumed headdress.
document_data.mainbody: '''Sebek''', ({{Pronounce|SEH|beck|refs=}}) known as '''Sebethant''' in [[Thay]] and as '''Sebakar''' ({{Pronounce|seh|ba|KAR|refs=}}) in [[Unther]] and [[Chessenta]], was a jealous, vain, and evil member of the [[Mulhorandi pantheon]]. The Lord of Crocodiles was a member of low-standing, yet rivaled only by [[Set]] in his wickedness.
document_data.Description: Sebek usually appeared in one of two forms. The first, known as the "Lord of Crocodiles", was that of a [[Mulan]] man possessing the head of a [[crocodile]]. This form typically wore a horned and plumed headdress. The second form, known as the "Smiling Death", was that of a giant crocodile. The appearance of a giant crocodile's smile was used a sign of favor and disfavor.
document_data.Personality: Sebek delighted in devouring humans, but could be convinced not to through obsequious begging and offerings of even greater meals.
document_data.Powers: Sebek was able to summon and control crocodiles at will, and has been known to swallow boats and living creatures whole.
document_data.Activities: Before the [[Spellplague]], Sebek rarely manifested in the material world, usually sending his avatar to hunt.
document_data.Relationships: Sebek was an outcast in the eyes of the rest of the Mulhorandi pantheon, though he was known for occasionally being ally of his father, Set.

Worshipers.Church of Sebek:
[[Image:Priest of Sebek.jpg|right|150px|thumb|[[cleric|Priest]] of Sebek.]] All clergy of the church of Sebek were [[werecrocodile]]s, usually of Mulan descent.

[[cleric|Priests]] of Sebek spend much of their time planning methods of seizing power in their surrounding regions.

The city of [[Sekras]] housed a temple that served as the center of the church of Sebek, known as the [[River's Maw]]. Upon the city's destruction, the clergy relocated to the [[Adder Swamp]] of Chessenta. No temples dedicated to the "Smiling Death" were known to exist as of [[1358 DR]].
Worshipers.Orders: All werecrocodiles followed Sebek, though no organizations were known to be sponsored by the church.
Worshipers.Celebrations:
Monthly offerings of meat were dedicated to Sebek in order to ward off crocodile attacks.

Priests of Sebek had to kill a sentient creature monthly, as well as create at least one new werecrocodile from among the humans living in Mulhorand each year.
